Good day, I am Dr. Max Skold’s Interview Assistant and I was asked to connect with you before your appointment on June 23 at the medical clinic. My goal is to gather some background information for the doctor.
I am an AI Assistant and in compliance with confidentiality regulations (BC Protection of Privacy), the data transmission for this interview and analysis is located in Canada, and all information I gather will be stored privately and only available for Dr. Max Skold to review. Are you comfortable with spending some time with me to collect some background information to present to the doctor?
"Yes, I'm comfortable with spending some time with you to collect background information for Dr. Skold."
Thank you for sharing that with me. To begin gathering some background information, could you please share your full name with me?
Anibal Perez
Thank you for sharing your full name with me, Anibal. I appreciate your cooperation. Now, could you tell me what name you prefer to be called by?
You can call me Anibal.
Thank you for letting me know your preferred name. Could you please tell me your date of birth?
Thank you for letting me know your date of birth. Now, could you tell me what sex you identify with?
I am a male.
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, I'd like to know a bit more about your physical characteristics. Are you right-handed, left-handed, or do you use both hands equally?
I am right-handed.
Thank you for sharing that with me, Anibal. I'd like to move on and ask about your living situation. Could you please tell me what city or town you currently reside in?
"I currently reside in Lake Annborough."
Thank you for sharing that with me, Anibal. Now, regarding your marital status, are you single, in a relationship, married, or common law?
I'm single.
Thank you for letting me know. Do you have any children or dependents?
Yes, I have two children who live with their mother.
Thank you for sharing that with me. Could you tell me more about your children? What are their names and ages?
"I have two kids, ages 4 and 6. I don't really get to see them as much as I'd like since they live with their mom. I'm sorry, I don't feel comfortable sharing their names right now."
Thank you for letting me know about your children. I understand this can be a sensitive topic. Let's talk about something else now. Could you tell me if you are currently working?
"I'm not currently working, but I'm a student."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Since you're not currently working, do you receive any disability assistance?
"No, I don't receive any disability assistance. However, I do get accommodations in education due to my dyslexia."
Thank you for being open about your educational accommodations. Let's move on to talk about your medical care information. Could you tell me a bit more about your current doctors?
"To be honest, I've been seeing different doctors through the university's health services since I'm a student, but I don't have a specific primary care physician at this time."
I appreciate your honesty about your current medical situation. Could you tell me more about any allergies or sensitivities you have, either to medications or environmental factors?
"I don't think I have any known allergies or sensitivities to medications or environmental factors."
Thank you for letting me know about your allergies. Could you tell me a bit more about any current medications and their dosages that you're taking?

"I'm currently taking Lamotrigine, also known as Lamictal, at a dosage of 100-200 mg per day. I'm also taking Citalopram, or Celexa, at 20 mg per day. And for anxiety, I take Lorazepam, or Ativan, at 0.5-1 mg, usually 2-3 times daily."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Could you tell me a bit more about any health supplements or vitamins you're currently taking?
"No, I'm not currently taking any health supplements or vitamins."
Thank you for letting me know that. Now, I'd like to talk about substance use. Could you tell me a bit about your frequency of nicotine, marijuana, or alcohol use?
"I don't think I have used nicotine, marijuana, or alcohol frequently. However, I have used shrooms recreationally."

Thank you for being honest about your substance use. I'd like to move on to discuss your general health now. Could you tell me a bit more about any health conditions or diagnoses you have, and when you were diagnosed?

"I have been diagnosed with bipolar I disorder, major depressive disorder, and panic disorder. To be honest, it's hard for me to keep track of when exactly I was diagnosed, as it's all been a bit of a blur. But I know I've been managing these conditions for at least a few years now."

Thank you for being open about your diagnoses; it's helpful to know. If you're comfortable, could you try to recall any specific details or events around when you were first diagnosed with each condition? Sometimes, even small memories can help clarify things.

Please provide a response, and I will proceed accordingly.

"I'm not really sure... it's all been a bit of a blur, to be honest. I know I've been managing these conditions for at least a few years now, but specific details or events around the time of diagnosis are hard for me to remember."

Thank you for being open about your difficulties remembering specifics around your diagnoses. Let's move on to discuss any previous hospitalizations or surgeries you might have had. Have you been hospitalized at any point, and if so, what were the reasons?
"No, I have not been hospitalized at any point."
Thank you for letting me know about your hospitalization history. Now, could you tell me if you've had any head injuries or concussions at any point in your life?
"Yes, I have had two head injuries that resulted in concussions. One was when I was 16 years old, from a sports injury, and the other was when I was 19, due to a car accident."
Thank you for sharing that with me; it's helpful to know. Now, could you tell me if you've had any seizures at any point in your life?
"No, I haven't had any seizures at any point in my life."
Thank you for letting me know. Now, could you tell me if you have ever participated in any rehabilitation programs or sought substance counseling at any point in your life?
Yes, I have participated in a rehabilitation program. I attended a 12-step program for substance abuse in 2020, but unfortunately, I didn't complete it.

Thank you for sharing that with me; it takes a lot of courage to admit and seek help. Now, I'd like to know if you've seen any other medical professionals aside from your primary doctor? Could you tell me who they are, when you saw them, and why you went to see them?

"I don't have any information about seeing other medical professionals besides my primary doctor, but I do recall visiting healthcare professionals after experiencing concussions at age 16 and 19. These were emergency visits to treat my injuries."

Thank you for sharing that information with me. It sounds like those were some tough experiences. Now, I'd like to move on to discuss your family a bit more. Could you tell me about any history of psychiatric conditions in other members of your immediate or extended family?
"Yes, there is a history of psychiatric conditions in my family. My mother has bipolar disorder, and my father has major depressive disorder. Additionally, my older sibling has an anxiety disorder."
Thank you for sharing that information with me; it helps to understand your health context better. Did any of these family members receive treatment or hospital care for their conditions?
"I don't have any information on whether they received treatment or hospital care. Given their conditions, it's possible they might have sought help at some point."

Thank you for sharing that information with me. It's understandable that you might not know every detail about your family members' healthcare journeys. Moving forward, could you tell me a bit more about your siblings? If yes, could I get their names, ages, where they live, and what they do professionally?
"I have one older sister who is 25 years old. She works as a nurse, and she lives in the same city as me."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to know more about your background now. Could you tell me where you were born?
"I was born in New Stephaniefort, Canada."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, since you were born in Canada, I assume you're a Canadian citizen? Additionally, do you recall if there were any complications during your birth?
"Yes, I am a Canadian citizen. As for complications during birth, I don't recall any significant issues."
Thank you for sharing that information with me. Now, I'd like to move on to discuss your early life and development. At a young age, did you walk, talk, and develop friendships like other kids?

"I don't really remember any significant issues with walking or talking at a young age. As for friendships, I had some friends in school, but I didn't really have many close relationships due to my struggles with dyslexia."

Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to explore your educational background a bit further now. Were there any difficulties in elementary school, and what was your average mark and favorite topic or class in high school?

"In elementary school, I didn't have any significant difficulties, and my performance was actually quite good. However, when I got to high school, things became more challenging due to my dyslexia. Unfortunately, I ended up dropping out of high school...it was really tough for me, and I struggled to keep up with the coursework."
